Package com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager

The layoutmanager package extends org.apache.PdfBox with tools for line-breaking, page-breaking, tables, and styles.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CellBuilder
    Something that can be built into a table cell, or just something rendered within a box model (like HTML) where the table-free cell is the box.
    Renderable
    Implementing Renderable means being suitable for use with a two-pass layout manager whose first pass says, "given this width, what is your height?" and second pass says, "Given these dimensions, draw yourself as best you can."
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BorderStyle
    Holds the LineStyles for the top, right, bottom, and left borders of a PdfItem.
    BorderStyle.Builder
    Factory helper-class for constructing immutable BorderStyle instances.
    Cell
    A styled table cell or layout block with a pre-set horizontal width.
    Cell.Builder
    A mutable Builder for somewhat less mutable cells.
    CellStyle
    The style of a cell including: horizontal alignment, padding, background color, and border style.
    CellStyle.Builder
    A mutable Builder for immutable CellStyles.
    LineStyle
    Represents the color and width of a line.
    LogicalPage
    Maybe better called a "DocumentSection" this represents a group of Renderables that logically belong on the same page, but may spill over multiple subsequent pages as necessary in order to fit.
    Padding
    Represents minimum spacing of the top, right, bottom, and left sides of PDF Page Items.
    PdfItem
    Represents items to be later drawn to the page of a PDF file.
    PdfLayoutMgr
    The main class in this package; it handles page and line breaks.
    ScaledJpeg
    Represents a Jpeg image and the document units it should be scaled to.
    ScaledPng
    Represents a PNG image and the document units it should be scaled to.
    TableBuilder
    Use this to create Tables.
    TablePart
    A set of styles to be the default for a table header or footer, or whatever other kind of group of table rows you dream up.
    TableRowBuilder
    Unsynchronized mutable class which is not thread-safe.
    Text
    Represents styled text kind of like a #Text node in HTML.
    TextStyle
    Specifies font, font-size, color, and padding.
    XyDim
    Represents a 2D dimension in terms of X and Y where both X and Y must be non-negative.
    XyOffset
    Represents a 2D coordinate in terms of X and Y where negative y is down from the upper left-hand corner.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    CellStyle.Align
    Horizontal and vertical alignment options for cell contents
    LogicalPage.Orientation  

Package com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager Description

The layoutmanager package extends org.apache.PdfBox with tools for line-breaking, page-breaking, tables, and styles. It provides an abstraction that lets lines and shaded backgrounds cross physical pages (vertically) to produce a larger logical page. This allows text, table cells, and images flow naturally from one page to the next.

Unlike the PDF spec and PDFBox, all measurements are specified in positive document units and all positioning is specified from the top-left corner of the item being positioned. Like PDFBox, positive y-values are toward the top of the page, so you have to *decrement* y every time you move down a line.

Items are given a Z-index internally to determine which overwrites which when there is overlap. If two items overlap and have the same Z-index, the last one specified overwrites the first (they are simply rendered in order).

Classes representing page objects are designed to minimize mutability and side-effects, but PdfLayoutMgr and the underlying PDFContentStream it acts upon are mutable, have side effects (they write output), and are NOT thread-safe.

Start by looking at the unit test and the sample PDF it builds. Then PdfLayoutMgr is the class to start with to use the API yourself.
